text:
(1)
New Street, at the N.W. corner of Heberton Avenue, showing Public School No. 20, erected in 1891. The school occupies a whole square block bounded by New and Vreeland Streets and Park and Heberton Avenues.

About 1905

By Mulford Simonson
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr

(2) and (3)
Views 2 and 3 were taken July 15, 1930 and August 30, 1937, respectively.

P. L. Sperr

New Street, at the N. W. corner of Heberton Avenue, showing the garden of Public School No. 20. Views 1 and 2 were taken the same time.

About 1910
Views 1,2

By Mulford Simonson
From F. L. Sperr Collection

New Street, at the N. W. corner of Heberton Avenue, showing the garden of Public School No. 20. Views 1 and 2 were taken the same time.

About 1910
Views 1,2

By Mulford Simonson
From F. L. Sperr Collection

(1)
New Street, at the N.W. corner of Heberton Avenue. Shown is the rear of Public School No. 20, looking southward along Heberton Avenue from Bennett Street.

April 2, 1924

P. L. Sperr

(2)
Another view of the rear of the old school building and the new additon (right) facing on Park Avenue, seen across Port Richmond Park from Park Avenue and Bennett Street.

July 5, 1932

P. L. Sperr
